Package renderer

Class Render

java.lang.Object
renderer.Render
public class Render
extends java.lang.Object
Render class responsible to render the scene
Author:
Aviel Buta and Yakir Yohanan

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  Render.Pixel
    Pixel is an internal helper class whose objects are associated with a Render object that they are generated in scope of.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Camera _camera
    The camera of the scene
    (package private) ImageWriter _imageWriter
    The object responsible to make the jpeg after the render of the scene
    (package private) RayTracerBase _rayTracerBase
    The ray tracer object to trace after the rays from the camera to the scene objects
    private boolean adaptiveGrid
    To cast rays adaptively (true) or not (false)
    static int MAX_DEPTH_OF_ADAPTIVE
    Static variable for determine the max depth number of the recursion
    private boolean print
    Printing progress percentage True for print, false else
    private static int SPARE_THREADS
    How many threads we want to stay release.
    static int STARTING_DEPTH
    Static variable for determine the starting number of the recursion depth
    private static int STARTING_SIGN
    Static variable for determine the starting sign of the quarter 1 equals to plus sign and -1 equals to minus sign In particular: 1, 1 - The first quarter -1, 1 - The second quarter -1,-1 - The third quarter 1,-1 - The fourth quarter
    private boolean superSampling
    To cast multiple rays (super sampling) - true, or not - false
    private int threadsCount
    Count the threads

    Print a grid on the image
    void renderImage()
    Go through all the pixels and calculate their color and paint them
    private void renderImageThreaded()
    This function renders image's pixel color map from the scene included with the Renderer object - with multi-threading

    • SPARE_THREADS

      private static final int SPARE_THREADS
      How many threads we want to stay release. Spare threads if trying to use all the cores.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

      Printing progress percentage True for print, false else

    • STARTING_SIGN

      private static final int STARTING_SIGN
      Static variable for determine the starting sign of the quarter 1 equals to plus sign and -1 equals to minus sign In particular: 1, 1 - The first quarter -1, 1 - The second quarter -1,-1 - The third quarter 1,-1 - The fourth quarter

    • setMultithreading

      public Render setMultithreading​(int threads)
      Set multi-threading
      - if the parameter is 0 - number of cores less 2 is taken
      Parameters:
      threads - number of threads
      Returns:
      the Render object itself

    • castRay

      private void castRay​(int nX, int nY, int col, int row)
      Cast ray from camera in order to paint a pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - resolution on X axis (number of pixels in row)
      nY - resolution on Y axis (number of pixels in column)
      col - pixel's column number (pixel index in row)
      row - pixel's row number (pixel index in column)

    • adaptiveGridDOF

      private Color adaptiveGridDOF​(int nX, int nY, int col, int row)
      Cast rays adaptively to the object and calculate the final color of the pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      col - column index of the point in the view plane (int)
      row - row index of the point in the view plane (int)
      Returns:
      The final color of the pixel (Color)

    • adaptiveGridDOF2

      private java.util.List<Color> adaptiveGridDOF2​(Point3D focalPoint, int depth, int signX, int signY, java.util.List<Color> oldColors, Point3D centerOfPixel)
      Parameters:
      focalPoint - The point on the focal plane
      depth - The depth of the recursion
      signX - The X sign of the current quarter
      signY - The Y sign of the current quarter
      oldColors - List of colors we already calculate
      centerOfPixel - The center of the sub-pixel
      Returns:
      List of the corners colors and the average of them

    • adaptiveGrid

      private Color adaptiveGrid​(int nX, int nY, int col, int row)
      Cast rays adaptively to the object and calculate the final color of the pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      col - column index of the point in the view plane (int)
      row - row index of the point in the view plane (int)
      Returns:
      The final color of the pixel (Color)

    • adaptiveGrid2

      private java.util.List<Color> adaptiveGrid2​(int nX, int nY, int depth, int signX, int signY, java.util.List<Color> oldColors, Point3D centerOfPixel)
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      depth - The depth of the recursion
      signX - The X sign of the current quarter
      signY - The Y sign of the current quarter
      oldColors - List of colors we already calculate
      Returns:
      List of the corners colors and the average of them

    • renderImageThreaded

      private void renderImageThreaded()
      This function renders image's pixel color map from the scene included with the Renderer object - with multi-threading

      Go through all the pixels and calculate their color and paint them

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int interval, Color color)
      Print a grid on the image
      Parameters:
      interval - The interval between all grid lines (int)
      color - The color of the lines (Color)
